messages.title: my plan for Reading West
messages.content:
1. Encouraging further business investment locally and delivering more high-quality jobs.
2. Delivering an outstanding education for all our children, having supported parent groups to set up the Wren School and All Saints Junior School.
3. Continuing to campaign for more rail and road funding, having already won millions for local projects.
4. Campaigning for more local police officers and a change in the law to tackle illegal encampments, with 183 new officers recently announced for Thames Valley Police.
5. Improving and expanding our local NHS services, having successfully campaigned to maintain the hydrotherapy pool at The Royal Berkshire Hospital.
6. Championing sustainable housing development with additional local infrastructure, whilst continuing to protect our environment and valuable green spaces like Pincents Hill.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Alok was pleased recently to officially open the expanded Tilehurst Surgery which adds new patient treatment and consulting rooms, with GP and community hubs coming from the NHS Estates and Technology Transformation Fund across the country.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: SECURING MORE MONEY FOR OUR SCHOOLS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: In July, Alok held a meeting for local Reading school teachers to discuss the need for increased school funding. The government has announced £14 billion boost in funding for schools across England.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: BETTER ACCESSIBILITY FOR LOCAL RAIL COMMUTERS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Alok campaigned for step-free access at Theale Station and secured funding for various rail services, supporting local commuters.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: CHAMPIONING JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE WITH DISABILITIES
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Alok organized an event to encourage local Reading companies to sign up to become Disability Confident employers.
Alok holds public meetings to allow constituents to raise issues with local senior police officers. Government announced plans to recruit an extra 183 new officers for Thames Valley Police.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: PROTECTING OUR PRECIOUS ENVIRONMENT & TACKLING CLIMATE CHANGE
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reducing plastic waste was vital and the Government has taken steps to phase out single-use plastics.

leaflet.personalStatement: Alok is very much a local Reading man. He grew up in Earley and Whitley Wood and went to school in Reading. He was first elected as the Member of Parliament for Reading West in 2010 and has been working hard to deliver for all parts of his constituency.

quotes.text: Help us get Brexit done so we can focus on investment in NHS services, schools, police, protecting the environment and continuing to deliver a strong economy.
Prime Minister Boris Johnson achieved what many said was impossible, by negotiating a great new deal with the European Union.
Unfortunately, Jeremy Corbyn's Labour and the other Opposition parties voted again to delay getting Brexit done.

images.caption: SECURING MORE MONEY FOR OUR SCHOOLS
BETTER ACCESSIBILITY FOR LOCAL RAIL COMMUTERS
CHAMPIONING JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE WITH DISABILITIES
PROTECTING OUR PRECIOUS ENVIRONMENT & TACKLING CLIMATE CHANGE
SPEAKING UP FOR OUR LOCAL BUSINESSES & YOUNG JOB SEEKERS
Help me get Brexit done and deliver my plan for Reading West.
